question: It is true that budgeting helps in estimating and allocating financial resources efficiently.
It is false that manpower refers to only unskilled workers in a project.
It is true that raw materials, tools, and equipment are considered essential materials for a project.
It is false that estimating material costs does not include checking market prices from suppliers.
It is true that buying materials in bulk can help in reducing costs.
It is false that labor costs include only basic salaries and wages.
It is true that manpower budgeting should consider benefits, insurance, and overtime pay.
It is false that budgeting for manpower does not require identifying the number of workers needed.
It is true that hiring only essential workers can help reduce manpower costs.
It is false that supervisors do not play any role in organizing physical resources.
It is true that organizing physical resources ensures a smooth workflow and reduces wastage.
It is false that a restaurant supervisor does not need to organize ingredients and cooking equipment.
It is true that matching employees to suitable jobs improves productivity and job satisfaction.
It is false that work-life balance is not a factor in matching human needs with job needs.
It is true that a software developer should be assigned programming tasks instead of customer support duties.
It is false that junior nurses should handle critical patient care without proper training.
It is true that a proper chain of command helps prevent confusion and promotes teamwork.
It is false that engineers should handle brick-laying tasks on a construction site.
It is true that task allotment ensures each worker knows their specific role.
It is false that supervisors should not monitor and adjust task allotment.
It is true that directing at the supervisory level involves guiding and supervising employees.
It is false that incomplete instructions can improve workplace efficiency.
It is true that clear instructions help avoid mistakes and delays in a project.
It is false that feasibility of instructions is not important for employees.
It is true that a supervisor must ensure that mobile phone assembly workers follow proper steps.
It is false that feasibility in instructions means making them complicated.
It is true that supervisors should explain tasks clearly to avoid defective products.
It is false that training workers does not contribute to cost reduction.
It is true that motivation plays an important role in improving worker performance.
It is false that providing fair wages is unnecessary for employee motivation.
It is true that discipline in the workplace ensures smooth operations.
It is false that giving detailed instructions leads to confusion among workers.
It is true that a supervisorâ€™s role includes correcting mistakes made by employees.
It is false that teamwork and cooperation are unimportant in an organization.
It is true that establishing relationships among workers can reduce conflicts.
It is false that a disorganized workplace leads to better productivity.
It is true that organizing and budgeting go hand in hand in project planning.
It is false that setting a realistic budget is unnecessary for project success.
It is true that an efficient supervisor ensures both materials and manpower are well managed.
It is false that unnecessary hiring of workers reduces manpower costs.
It is true that work efficiency improves when tasks match employee skills.
It is false that businesses do not need to plan for unexpected expenses.
It is true that a clear reporting structure speeds up decision-making.
It is false that supervisors do not need to track worker performance.
It is true that reducing wastage of materials helps maintain the project budget.
It is false that workers perform best when given unclear instructions.
It is true that proper direction ensures employees stay motivated and productive.
It is false that discipline in the workplace negatively impacts employee performance.
It is true that a well-organized workplace increases overall efficiency.
It is false that organizing tasks is unnecessary for company success.
